column2: The Heralds of Faerûn are a quasi-independent group of historians and heraldists that take on the responsibility of recording the coats of arms, flags, standards, shields, badges, mottoes, symbols, and sigils of the nobility of Faerûn. Over the years, they also became the foremost authority on courtly courtesy, inheritance, precedence, genealogy, correct armature, and general history. Their impartiality and neutrality earned them the respect of nearly every nation, kingdom, city-state, mercenary company, clan, and tribe in civilized Faerûn.
Throughout the history of the Heralds, the office of Unicorn was considered the highest rank and had veto power.

As an Herald, you'll be expected to catalogue and preserve heraldic devices, lore and etiquette. You'll collect the names, titles, genealogies, and historical claims of faerunian nobility, for the sake preserving of history and help in the arbitration of disputes.
Court Heralds serve and represent their sovereign while trying to uphold the ideals of the Heralds.
Regional Heralds are scattered across Faerûn, usually based in cities, and each is responsible for their city and likely the surrounding countryside as well.

Herald Pursuivants serve as personal assistants to, or itinerant representatives of, the High Heralds, traveling wherever they are needed to assert authority, deliver messages, or conduct secret or sensitive Herald business.
High Heralds debate among themselves and vote on official matters. Each High Herald has an "office" that has a unique appellation they use instead of their real name when performing Herald duties.
Invite one or more characters to a private feast.
As a member of the Heralds, you can study the coats of arms, flags, standards, shields, badges, mottoes, symbols, and sigils of the nobility of Faerûn.
Study the Heralds' recorded lore on the nobility of Faerûn.

All Heralds are at least decent writers, and often employ professional scribes and researchers. When you use the Compose a Book decision, you'll finish the book quicker then normal, and lack of inspiration won't affect you as long.
Heralds are not supposed to pursue power, but their profound knowledge of history and genealogies makes it easy for them to craft very convincing documents, should the need arise.
The Heralds have massive amounts of historic lore, collected all over Faerun, and carefully preserved in majestic libraries. You now have the unique chance to study that lore.

You've been studying old history books and genealogies lost to time for months. Your Herald colleagues have been a great help in your research, but you're feeling a bit tired. Is it time to take a break from your studies?
No, I want to press on.
This character has been studying the Heralds' lore.
As a member of the Heralds, your word on the noble families of Faerun carries some weight. You can praise, defame or simply publish your research on a ruler of your choice.
Enables right clicking the portraits of other rulers in order to praise, defame or simply publish your research on them.

You've decided to invest time and effort writing about [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName]. Will you be impartial and only write about objective facts, or will you try to sway public opinion one way or the other?
I'm going to be utterly vicious.
I'll be impartial in my writings.

Your writings on [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] have definitely reached their goal: [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] is now regarded as a wise and respected ruler, and is fully aware that you are to be thanked for that.

Unfortunately, your writings on [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] have been widely considered to be nothing more than disingenuous flattery. Both your reputation and your target's have suffered as a result. [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] is not amused.

Your writings on [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] have definitely reached their goal: [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] is now looked upon as a troubled and incompetent ruler, and is fully aware that you are to be blamed for that..

Unfortunately, your writings on [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] have been widely considered to be nothing more than overblown vitriol. [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] is now regarded as a stern and pragmatic ruler, while your own reputation has suffered.

Your writings on [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] have been widely considered to be measured, informative and well-researched. [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] is pleased, and your own reputation has greatly improved.

Your writings on [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] have been widely considered to be incomplete, misinformed and half-assed. [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName] is insulted, and your own reputation has been damaged.
An influential member of the Heralds of Faerun has recently praised you publicly. As a result, you are now regarded as a wise and respected ruler.
An influential member of the Heralds of Faerun has recently tried to praise you, but ultimately came off as a disingenuous flatterer. As a result, your own reputation has suffered.
An influential member of the Heralds of Faerun has recently defamed your character publicly. As a result, you are now regarded as a troubled and incompetent ruler.

An influential member of the Heralds of Faerun has recently tried to defame your character publicly, but ultimately came off as a raging clown. As a result, you are now regarded as a stern and pragmatic ruler.

An influential member of the Heralds of Faerun has recently published some measured and informative research about you. While that won't sway the public opinion one way or the other, it'll certainly make you more famous.

An influential member of the Heralds of Faerun has recently published some incomplete and misinformed research about you. While that won't sway the public opinion one way or the other, it'll certainly spread some false notions about you that will likely take years to amend.
I know for a fact that, through my writings, I have earned the friendship of [writing_target.GetTitledFirstName]. Should I take advantage of this chance and propose a military alliance?
My friend, in this cruel world, true friends are a rare and precious thing. We should sign a military alliance, to help each other in our future wars. What do you say?
I accept your suggestion, my friend. No foe will be able to stand before our combined forces.
I thank you for the offer, my friend, but I cannot accept. Realm politics must always prevale over personal feelings.
